body_html:
I think the easiest way is to use the optimizer API to get the gradients. It will be returned as a nested map where you have the variable names on one side, and the gradients on the other. They come pre-multiplied by the global learning rate, and you can re-multiply.

Did you try on stackoverflow? Maybe there's an even simpler way.

body:
I think the easiest way is to use the optimizer API to get the gradients. It will be returned as a nested map where you have the variable names on one side, and the gradients on the other. They come pre-multiplied by the global learning rate, and you can re-multiply.

Did you try on stackoverflow? Maybe there's an even simpler way.
